library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
library(lubridate)
library(DT)
library(sf)


gws <- read.csv("https://github.com/Ludwigm6/grundwasser-amtsvenn/raw/refs/heads/main/appdata/gws.csv")
gws$Datum <- lubridate::as_date(gws$Datum)

gwsHeader = read.csv("https://github.com/Ludwigm6/grundwasser-amtsvenn/raw/refs/heads/main/appdata/gwsHeader.csv")
dams = read_sf("https://github.com/Ludwigm6/grundwasser-amtsvenn/raw/refs/heads/main/appdata/dams.geojson")



# Define UI for application that draws a histogram
ui <- fluidPage(
  # Application title
  titlePanel("Grundwasserstand Demo"),
  
  # Sidebar with a slider input for number of bins 
  sidebarLayout(
    sidebarPanel(
      sliderInput(inputId = "dateSelect",
                  label = "Datum:",
                  min = min(gws$Datum),
                  max = max(gws$Datum),
                  value = max(gws$Datum)),
      
      
      
      plotOutput("datumMap")
      
      
    ),
    
    # Show a plot of the generated distribution
    mainPanel(
      plotOutput("datumPlot"),
      
      
     
      DT::dataTableOutput("dailyMeasure")
      
      
      
    )
  )
)

# Define server logic required to draw a histogram
server <- function(input, output) {
  #gws = readRDS("data/gws.RDS")
  
  

  output$dailyMeasure = renderDT(datatable(gws |> filter(Datum == as.Date(input$dateSelect)),
                                           options = list(paging = FALSE))
                                 )
  
  
  output$datumPlot <- renderPlot({

    ggplot(gws, aes(x = Datum, y = GWS))+
      geom_point()+
      geom_vline(aes(xintercept = input$dateSelect), color = "firebrick3", lwd = 1)+
      facet_wrap(.~ID)

  })

  output$datumMap <- renderPlot({

    gwsHeader = left_join(gwsHeader, gws |> filter(Datum == as.Date(input$dateSelect)), by = "ID")

    ggplot()+
      geom_sf(data = dams)+
      geom_point(data = gwsHeader, mapping = aes(x = x, y = y, color = GWS), size = 3)+
      scale_color_viridis_c(limits = c(4090, 4340), na.value = "grey80")+
      theme_bw()






  })

  
}





# Run the application 
shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
